item.title: My Media and Gaming Setup
item.description: The setup consists of a media/gaming PC, a gaming laptop, a gaming PC, a music production desk, a retro games console setup, an arcade pedestal setup in front of a TV, and a lot of controllers and games. For a post on how I built my budget arcade emulation pedestal setup, with pictures, see: this post My Media/Gaming PC ‘studio.local’ 12th Gen i7 CPU 32GB DDR4 RAM 1x NVme M.

item.title: Budget Home Retro Arcade Setup
item.description: I’ve always wanted an arcade machine in my home. But I could never really afford one, in terms of time and space. Recently I thought to myself, “I’m not getting any younger”. So I built an arcade setup mostly just using the things I already had in the home. Games The ROMs I have are all stored on my file server upstairs. I can get around a 3gbits/sec connection via my 10gbits/sec home network, so there is no performance ‘hit’ in streaming them off the network drive - it has similar speed and latency to a physical drive.
